explanations.reason: The paper focuses on the moderating effect of XBRL adoption on the relationship between managerial ability and corporate tax outcomes, using quantitative methods and panel data regression models. There is no mention of any machine learning techniques, algorithms, or related concepts in the title or abstract. The study is grounded in accounting and finance, specifically examining tax avoidance and tax risk in the context of XBRL adoption, rather than any machine learning or artificial intelligence methodologies.
